title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file and the user shuts down Windows, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file and the user shuts down Windows, a warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
1. Open WSWB.
2. Create a new project.
3. Create a text file in the project.
4. Add a line of text to the text file.
5. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
6. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
7. Select the "Shut Down" command to shutdown/reboot the computer.
8. Verify that a warning or question message box appears, allowing users to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
